I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
instr: Set
data: Type
one_step: instr -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_fun: forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_dec: forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2}
P: subcode.code instr
Q: code
k: nat
st3: state
st2: state
st1: state

Goal:
in_code (fst st1) P -> out_code (fst st2) P -> out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> P // st1 ->> st2 -> Q//st1-[k]->st3 -> exists q : nat, q < k /\ Q//st2-[q]->st3

EnvRing.PX : EnvRing.Pol ?C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol ?C -> EnvRing.Pol ?C where ?C : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : subcode.code instr Q : code k : nat st1 : state st2 : state st3 : state |- Type]
subcode_sss_compute_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st3 -> P // st1 -> > st3
subcode_sss_terminates_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 ↓ -> P // st1 ↓
sss_compute_step_out_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 <> st2 -> out_code (fst st3) P -> P // st1 -> > st2 -> P//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists q : nat, q < k /\ P//st2-[q] -> st3
subcode_sss_step_inv_1 : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st1 :1> st2 -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2
subcode_sss_subcode_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (p k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> P//st1-[p] -> st2 -> Q//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists q : nat, k = p + q /\ Q//st2-[q] -> st3
subcode_sss_steps_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (k : nat) (st1 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> out_code (fst st3) P -> Q//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists (k1 k2 : nat) (st2 : state), P//st1-[k1] -> st2 /\ Q//st2-[k2] -> st3 /\ k = k1 + k2 /\ out_code (fst st2) P
subcode_sss_progress_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (p : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), out_code (fst st3) P -> P <sc Q -> P // st1 -+> st2 -> Q//st1-[p] -> st3 -> exists q : nat, q < p /\ Q//st2-[q] -> st3
subcode_sss_compute_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> out_code (fst st3) P -> Q // st1 -> > st3 -> exists st2 : state, P // st1 -> > st2 /\ Q // st2 -> > st3 /\ out_code (fst st2) P
in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_terminates_ind : forall (P : code) (R : state -> Prop), (forall st : state, out_code (fst st) P -> R st) -> (forall st1 : state, (forall (Q : subcode.code instr) (st2 : state), Q <sc P -> Q // st1 -+> st2 -> P // st2 ↓ -> R st2) -> R st1) -> forall st : state, P // st ↓ -> R st
sss_compute_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (st1 st2 st3 : state), out_code (fst st3) P -> P // st1 -> > st2 -> P // st1 -> > st3 -> P // st2 -> > st3
subcode_sss_step_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> Q // st1 :1> st2 -> P // st1 :1> st2
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (P : code) (ii : instr) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'
in_out_code : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : subcode.code X), in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
subcode_sss_compute_linstr : forall (k : nat) (li : list instr) (P : code) (st1 st2 st : state), (fst st1, li)//st1-[k] -> st2 -> (fst st1, li) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st -> P // st1 -> > st
sss_stall = fun (ii : instr) (st : state) => forall st' : state, ~ st ⟬ ii ⦒ st' : instr -> state -> Prop
subcode_out_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
sss_compute_max_ind : forall (P : code) (R : state -> state -> Prop), (forall st : state, sss_step_stall P st -> R st st) -> (forall st1 st3 : state, (forall (Q : subcode.code instr) (st2 : state), Q <sc P -> Q // st1 -+> st2 -> P // st2 -]] st3 -> R st2 st3) -> R st1 st3) -> forall st1 st3 : state, P // st1 -]] st3 -> R st1 st3
subcode_sss_compute_trans : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P <sc Q -> P // st1 -> > st2 -> Q // st2 -> > st3 -> Q // st1 -> > st3
sss_step_in_code : forall (P : code) (st1 st2 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> in_code (fst st1) P

intros instr data one_step sss_fun sss_dec P Q k st3 st2 st1 in_code_out st1_out st3_out in_subcode P_st1_st2 Q_st1_k_st3.
destruct P_st1_st2 as [Hk [Hl Hp]].
destruct Q_st1_k_st3 as [q [q_lt_k Q_st2_q_st3]].
exists q.
split.
- exact q_lt_k.
- exact Q_st2_q_st3.
```
